title.value: Multi-­tract multi-­symptom relationships in pediatric concussion
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: RESEARCH ARTICLE Multi-­tract multi-­symptom relationships in pediatric concussion

extractions.description: The paper investigates the heterogeneous nature of white matter damage and symptom presentation in pediatric concussions. Using diffusion MRI and multivariate statistical methods, the study explores multi-tract multi-symptom relationships to better understand the complexities of concussion impacts, presenting an approach that identifies specific structural and symptomatic relationships rather than one-to-one symptom-connectivity patterns.

type.justification: The paper involves data collection, analysis, and testing across a sample of children to study the relationships between white matter damage and concussion symptoms, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Methods: Using cross-­sectional data from 306 previously concussed children aged 9–10 from the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study, we built connectomes...

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on the brain's white matter and symptomatology related to concussions, which falls under the field of Neuroscience.
name.quote: Neuroscience and Mental Health, The Hospital for Sick Children, Toronto, Canada...

name.justification: The study heavily relies on diffusion MRI to examine brain structure, situating it within the field of Neuroimaging.
name.quote: To leverage, rather than average out, concussion heterogeneity, we combined dMRI and multivariate statistics to characterize multi-­tract multi-­symptom relationships.

name.justification: The focus on concussions in children categorizes this research within Pediatric Medicine.
name.quote: ...the impact of concussions on pediatric brains is understudied.

name.value: Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study (ABCD Study)
name.justification: The dataset was crucial for obtaining the data on concussed children, as directly referenced in the study.
name.quote: Data in this study were obtained from the world’s largest child development study of its kind – the ongoing longitudinal Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study (ABCD Study; https://abcd-study.org/)

referenced_paper_title.value: The Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) study: Imaging acquisition across 21 sites.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides background on the dataset used within this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Additional information about the ABCD Study can be found in Garavan et al., 2018.

name.justification: Tractoflow is used for processing diffusion MRI scans, as mentioned in the methods section.
name.quote: We used Tractoflow (Theaud et al., 2020) to process dMRI and T1-­weighted scans.

referenced_paper_title.value: TractoFlow: A robust, efficient and reproducible diffusion MRI pipeline leveraging Nextflow & Singularity.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference explains the foundation and application of Tractoflow used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

name.justification: FSL is part of the Tractoflow pipeline used in this study's methods.
name.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

referenced_paper_title.justification: FSL is mentioned as part of the Tractoflow processing system but not dedicated to a specific referenced paper title in this document.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

name.justification: Dipy is included in the data processing work through Tractoflow.
name.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Although Dipy is a part of the Tractoflow pipeline mentioned here, no specific reference paper for Dipy is mentioned in this document.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

name.justification: MRtrix is involved in processing the diffusion MRI data as part of Tractoflow.
name.quote: Tractoflow is a novel diffusion MRI processing pipeline, incorporating state-­of-­the-­art functions from FSL, Dipy, and MRtrix into NextFlow.

referenced_paper_title.justification: MRtrix is mentioned as part of data processing tools but lacks a specific reference paper title here.
